programme.title: Extinction: Going, Going, Gone
programme.desc: Studying the lifestyles and habitats of awe-inspiring creatures currently in danger to try to stem the tide of countless species from around the globe facing extinction.

programme.title: The Magic of the Wild
programme.desc: Yellowstone, the oldest national park on Earth, is famous for its diverse wildlife and a massive magma chamber in its depths that characterizes its distinctive landscapes.

programme.title: History Of Life On Earth
programme.desc: The first life forms on the planet were microscopic, single-celled organisms.

programme.title: Power of Plants
programme.desc: Like animals, the lives of plants are a race to grow and breed; they must race to beat their communities to the best light spots or to make the most of short seasons; to breed, some catapult offspring around the forest and some use the wind.

programme.title: Rescued Chimpanzees of the Congo with Jane Goodall
programme.desc: Through previously unseen footage, Dr. Jane Goodall creates a sanctuary for orphaned chimps.

programme.title: Time Flies
programme.desc: One thing people can't control is time passing, but they can change how they see things by using cameras to see the world in different time frames.

programme.title: Ancient Murders Unearthed
programme.desc: Homicide detective Rod Demery and scientist Professor Turi King visit the ancient Italian city of Verona to investigate the death of 14th-century warlord Cangrande della Scala, who died suddenly at the height of his power.

programme.title: Terror!
programme.desc: On July 22, 2011, Anders Breivik detonates a van bomb in Oslo's government quarter, killing eight and triggering chaos, then drives to a Norwegian island and opens fire at a Workers' Youth League summer camp, killing 69 participants.

programme.title: Terror!
programme.desc: The USS Cole is docked for refueling in Aden, Yemen, when two men in a small boat ram the warship at full speed and the resulting explosion kills 17 sailors Oct. 12, 2000.

programme.desc: The minions find robots to control the world's population.

programme.sub-title: Create Me the Ultimate Surveillance State

programme.title: Heroes of the Deep
programme.desc: Within sight of Rügen, the Baltic Sea divers drop anchor to salvage lost plastic "ghost nets," which can prove deadly traps for sea creatures; diver Erik acts cautiously around the wreck of the fishing cutter Friedrich Engels that sank in 1973.

programme.title: Heroes of the Deep
programme.desc: Together with research divers, the Baltic Sea divers try to capture unique images of harbor porpoises looking for food; they work to salvage a 17-meter-long ship that sank deep into the silt of the harbor basin.

programme.desc: Investigating the cause of an alarming decline in insect populations that could devastate all life on Earth and whether anything can be done to stop it.

programme.title: Someone They Knew with Tamron Hall
programme.desc: In 2001, University of South Carolina student Shelton Sanders disappeared while planning a friend's bachelor party; he was never seen again; when evidence leads to an arrest, however, prosecutors are left with a tall task.

programme.title: Someone They Knew with Tamron Hall
programme.desc: When Vicki Beckham was found dead in her car on the side of a mountain road, with very little evidence, police called it almost the perfect crime; but a series of clues blew the case open, taking them from a strip club bouncer to a Bishop's son.

programme.title: Someone They Knew with Tamron Hall
programme.desc: Divorce wasn't enough to end the animosity between James and Linda Cooney; the bitterness continued until Linda shot James dead with a .357 Magnum; she claimed self-defense, but the only witness was their 10-year-old son.

programme.desc: The Pulse with Bill Anderson is a weekly tv program and podcast featuring topical discussions and interviews surrounding current local issues, events, and entertainment. Each week Bill will welcome guests from all walks of life to talk about the topics that have the attention of our community and beyond. The Pulse will air weekly on FOX 29 in Philly as well as FOX Soul nationwide and be distributed on all major podcast outlets. In addition to hosting The Pulse Bill also manages the content of the station's special reports, including the Our Race Reality series of segments and specials. He also reports on the brighter side of life in his regular news series For Goodness' Sake.
